actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow individuals a credit against income tax for qualified fire detector expenses.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an income tax credit for 50 percent of the cost of purchasing and installing fire detectors in the residence of any taxpayer. Limits the amount of such credit to $100 for a taxable year ($50 in the case of a married individual filing a separate return).

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow individuals a credit against income tax for qualified fire detector expenses.
